The Liao River source area is located in the southwest of Jilin Province with the latitude-longitude range of 123°43′~125°32′E, 42°36′~44°18′N, a typical cold area in northeastern China (see Fig. 8). Figure 8(a) shows the geographical location of the study area, the watershed is marked with shadow. Figure 8(b) shows the study area with the digital elevation map for modeling and the locations of weather stations. The study area is the watershed covered the Liao River basin, the Zhaosutai River basin and the Tiaozi River basin with an area of 11283 km 2. The watershed elevation ranges from 122 to 612 meters. The watershed is characterized by semi-humid and semi-arid climates. The temperature and precipitation decreases gradually from southeast to northwest. The annual average temperature is 5.2 °C, with the lowest value of–14.8 °C in January, and average annual precipitation is 545 mm, with approximately 80% of the annual precipitation concentrates during June through September
